channel.title: Pythonista on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in Pythonista on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Play with UI implementation of Pythonista [Screen transition]
item.description: #Introduction The update is slow, but I’m still talking about the UI implementation of Pythonista! Continuing from the previous article, this time I will implement screen transitions. If you haven’t touched Pythonista yet, please read the following articles. (Since there is no story, you can understand this article without reading the following article if you have prerequisite knowledge) [Past article] Play with UI implementation of Pythonista3 [super super introduction] Play with UI implementation of Pythonista [screen element] Play with UI implementation of Pythonista [Implementation of Action]

item.title: [Python] What failed when Javaer changed to Pythonista
item.description: # at first This is the 12/2 charge article for PyCon JP Advent Calendar 2016. There are other interesting articles, so if you are interested, please check it out. I have written Java in some places, but it may be wrong because it has been a while, so I hope you can read it while thinking about it. Purpose As the subject says, I’ll share the mistakes I’ve made so that anyone reading this can make the transition from Javaer to Pythonista smoother.
